thread.title: Giudice And Her Ratings Are In The Can
thread.title_full: Giudice And Her Ratings Are In The Can - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Giudice And Her Ratings Are In The Can
text:
Joe Corrigan/Getty Images Teresa Giudice before she traded ball gowns for a ball and chain Teresa Giudice’s television career is looking ever-more shaky following her first on-air appearance since going to jail.
We’re told that Bravo execs - hoping to draw up a game plan for after the “Real Housewives of New Jersey” star’s release in December - had been anxiously awaiting ratings for the Oct. 10 special about her incarceration.
The three-part series, “Real Housewives of New Jersey: Teresa Checks In,” had been seen as the first opportunity to gauge how she will go over with viewers since she began a 10-month stretch in January for fraud.
The results are not what they’d hoped for, we’re told.
While fans’ first opportunity to hear from Teresa since she went to the big house might have been must-watch TV, “Real Housewives of New Jersey: Teresa Checks In” got just 1.2 million viewers - which is around the same number that a regular episode of the New Jersey franchise attracts.
“Viewers don’t seem to want to support criminals, and Bravo is paying attention,” an insider told Confidenti@l, “They’ll see what the rating are for the (the remaining parts) and go from there.”
Not helping matters, sources close to the show say that Teresa - who only appears on the show via telephone from Danbury prison in Connecticut - and her husband Joe’s strategy for hanging on to fans as they face consecutive stints in jail have been disastrous.
“She should play up how difficult it is so that when she comes out, people want to hear what she has to say,” said a source.
Instead, said the insider, “They have the daughter (Gia) saying Teresa looks great, Joe’s saying (the jail is) basically like a low budget spa, they’re delivering diamond necklaces and Teresa’s doing yoga.”
On the Oct. 10 episode, a stylist hired to get Gia ready for her high school formal presented her with a diamond and sapphire necklace.
The insider adds that Joe’s recent appearance on Andy Cohen’s “Watch What Happens Live” backfired when said that it was his brother-in-law Joe Gorga’s fault that Teresa is in jail.
“Joe Giudice doing that live interview did no favors for him,” said the source, “Bravo can clean them up (on “The Real Housewives”) and make them look like good people, but when you put him on TV, he is who he is and he doesn’t take accountability.”
While sources tell us that Bravo insiders worry that the viewing figures suggest that fans won’t warm to Teresa after her release, another source close to the show says they’re hopeful that the faithful will flock back when she appears in person when she is released next month, rather than over the telephone on a limited run special.
Got some hot gossip for us?
